alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 3:01PM MST until July 27 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Tanner Wash and Bitter Springs in northwestern Coconino County in Arizona... * Until 600 PM MST. * At 258 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near and southeast of Bitter Springs. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bitter Springs, Tanner Wash, and portions Grand Canyon National Park. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 513 and 526. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 526. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tiger Wash, Tanner Wash, Curve Wash and Jackass Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Enhanced risk for violent, life-threatening flash flooding in slot canyons and normally dry washes. Flash floods can come from distant thunderstorms, even with little or no rainfall in the immediate area.
